arts.ttl: Under-pressure Michael Carrick vows to keep fighting after Middlesbrough's fourth straight loss
arts.sum: Michael Carrick vowed to keep fighting as Middlesbrough manager and says he maintains 100% belief that he can turn things around. With the Boro head coach searching for a turnaround, he made changes for this game that ultimately didn’t pay off.
How the game at the Riverside unfolded as Moussa Sissoko's thumping header secured a deserved 1-0 win.

arts.ttl: Watford’s winless run over as Moussa Sissoko mounts more misery on Middlesbrough
arts.sum: Michael Carrick’s side were booed off after their fourth straight Championship defeat.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick's keep the faith Middlesbrough message ahead of crucial Watford game
arts.sum: When that potential was put to Carrick ahead of the game, he said: “I understand the disappointment and frustration of supporters because they want and expect results and come to watch winning teams, exciting football and goals. “It’s something you’ve got to accept and it’s up to us to put things into the game with energy and a performance level for the supporters to get behind us and create that support, noise and atmosphere.

arts.ttl: 'Character' point made as Tommy Conway is backed for big Middlesbrough role after Latte Lath exit
arts.sum: Michael Carrick has backed Tommy Conway to step up and become Middlesbrough ’s main man up top after Emmanuel Latte Lath’s exit, saying the young striker has the character to thrive off the pressure and expectation. Asked if Conway, 22, can step up in Latte Lath’s absence, Carrick said: “I think that's the type of character you have to be.

arts.ttl: Louza has developed into one of Watford's leaders
arts.sum: The midfielder barely played in the first part of the season but since getting back into the team has been both outstanding and consistent.

arts.ttl: Under-pressure Watford boss Tom Cleverley makes huge Middlesbrough admission
arts.sum: “I’ve said to the players, ‘keep believing in the way you’re training and playing because ultimately it will bring results over a long period of time’. Tom Cleverley says Saturday’s game at Middlesbrough has to be win at all costs as he faced up to the pressure he is under at Watford.

arts.ttl: I'm not too stubborn to change my Middlesbrough approach but I still believe it will work
arts.sum: With that in mind, asked if he still believed his approach and style was still the right way to bring about better results for Boro, Carrick said: “Yeah, 100%. It’s a tight pack chasing two remaining play-off spots and Boro do have a game in hand on all the teams around them, but current form and clear issues that have been a problem all season make it clear that huge improvements are needed if Boro are to make their top-six aspirations a reality.

arts.ttl: First impressions of Kelechi Iheanacho as Middlesbrough expectations are set after debut
arts.sum: Our panel this week consists of Youtuber and talkSport journalist Phil Spencer, Boro Breakdown co-host Dana Malt, Boropolis co-founder Chris Cassidy and Twe12th Man member John Donovan. While Michael Carrick played down the word replacement, and of course Boro also have Tommy Conway too, they will ultimately need Iheanacho to chip in and contribute in some way between now and the end of the season if they are to achieve their promotion goal, with Latte Lath's goals so important to the side prior to his exit.

arts.ttl: ‘Really underachieving’ – Middlesbrough vs Watford prediction: The72
arts.sum: The72's writers offer their Middlesbrough vs Watford prediction ahead of the Championship clash on Saturday. The post ‘Really underachieving’ – Middlesbrough vs Watford prediction: The72 appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
